caption:
This aerial photograph captures an expansive water treatment facility situated near a large body of water, possibly a lake or coastal area. The facility is composed of numerous rectangular and interconnected clear water basins, structured in a precise and orderly grid pattern. Each basin is outlined and separated by narrow land strips, and some basins appear to have darker water, suggesting different stages or processes of water treatment.

The facility includes several small buildings that may serve as control stations or pump houses, located strategically across the site. There are also several paths or roads that provide access to different parts of the facility, useful for maintenance and operational purposes.

Surrounding the facility is a natural landscape that contrasts sharply with the man-made structure. There are areas covered in lush greenery, likely marshlands or wetlands, contributing to a diverse ecological environment. The background further stretches into a horizon where the water body meets the sky, giving a sense of the facilityâ€™s considerable size and its proximity to natural water sources.

The photograph is taken from a high vantage point, giving a comprehensive view of the relationship between the engineering project and its surrounding natural environment. Its layout and design are indicative of careful planning aimed at maximizing efficiency in water treatment processes, highlighting the technological and environmental considerations involved in such a facility.
title: Development of artificial reefs at Marco Island. (From the sites exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 102, 103, 104, 105, 106.)
